description:
《英文天天写》是沪江社团一档写作类社刊，其目的在于提升大家的英语写作能力。每期节目主持人都会给出一个话题，积极参加的童鞋还会得到主持人的专业点评哦！想提高英语写作的童鞋千万不要错过哦！去沪江社团订阅本社刊！

               

话题：

Writing: imagine a scenario or express your opinion
Refer
To refer means to point towards a source of information. What or who is referring? How is the action done? What will be the outcome?
This week's topic: They referred to their notes... (90-110 words)

Suggestions:
1) refer to the source document
2) refer to the records
3) refer a friend
4) refer the case to a higher court
5) Instead of writing a scenario, feel free to comment on the story below.

范例1：

Wolfe had the impression that the model did not like him from the get-go. That stunning face, Wolfe could not deny that, seemed to be always smirking at him. Of course, that could just be how the model smiled, but then again, Wolfe had seen him show a completely different smile to other people and in his photoshoots. Ah, whatever, focus Wolfe, focus! “Very well, what have you been up to lately?” Wolfe continued with his questions. “Depends on what you are referring to, I have been kept quite busy lately.”

想要得到专业主持人的点评和意见吗？快来节目现场一试身手吧>>

  • 国产修图app火了：老外表示我好美！爱死了！

  • 天天练口语，让你想说就说！

  • 外媒：台湾男子献血救到未来老婆 这缘分我服

title: 英文天天写：Refer

description:
Now the new year is set to be a new start for Ukraine, economically speaking at least. On January 1st, the country starts its free trade agreement with the European Union. The pact will remove almost all barriers and tariffs between their economies. Many Ukrainians see this as a major step towards integration into Europe. Not so happy is Ukraine's powerful neighbour Russia. Moscow says it's suspending its free trade zone with Ukraine because it says the EU-Ukraine pact could lead to a flood of European imports into Russia and make its own exports to Ukraine less competitive. The whole trade spat has escalated into a tit-for-tat. Ukraine now says it's banning imports of some Russian goods. Lilit Gevorgyan is senior economist at IHS Global Insight.

All for Ukraine for a start, Russia remains a single most important trading country. It is a very important export destination. So Russian capital, Russian investment in Ukraine was significant. Obviously it has been dwindling down in the past two years. Their industries, because of the Soviet legacy, are quite intertwined. The eastern regions of Ukraine are heavily dependent on Russia as their export market, but also as a supply market. On top of that Russia is also quite dependent on these regions because, for example, some of the Russian military industry, prior to the current crisis, had set up research and development centres in eastern Ukraine.
